events.title: William and Mary Proclaimed Co-Rulers of England
events.description: Following the Glorious Revolution, William III and Mary II were declared joint sovereigns of England, Scotland, and Ireland.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of constitutional monarchy in England and the solidification of parliamentary power over the monarchy.

events.title: The Confederate States of America Formed
events.description: Delegates from southern states met in Montgomery, Alabama, to form the Confederate States of America, with Jefferson Davis elected as president.
events.significance: This was a key moment leading up to the American Civil War, signaling the formal secession of southern states from the Union.

events.title: Battle of Guadalcanal Ends
events.description: The United States declared victory after capturing the Solomon Islands from Japanese forces in World War II.
events.significance: A decisive victory for the Allies, it marked a turning point in the Pacific theater during WWII.

events.title: The Beatles Appear on The Ed Sullivan Show
events.description: The Beatles made their first live American TV appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show, watched by millions.
events.significance: This appearance launched Beatlemania in the United States and had a profound impact on popular culture.

events.title: Alfred McAlpine Announces Sale of Civil Engineering Division
events.description: One of the major UK construction companies began restructuring to focus on housebuilding after announcing the sale of its civil engineering division.
events.significance: The move reflected broader economic changes in the construction industry during the 1990s.
